data.description: Mitsubishi Power Americas, Inc. in Lake Mary, FL is seeking an Associate, Engineering Document Management. COMPANY OVERVIEW At Mitsubishi Power, we’re not just building better clean energy technologies; we’re architecting a better future. Our team is boldly redefining power generation to accelerate the world’s energy transition. We operate as one team, pushing toward our vision of the future. We value problem solvers, prioritize collaboration, and support each other in an inclusive culture built on accountability and authenticity by demonstrating our values: Safety, Family, Innovative, Inclusive, Accountable & Courageous. Together, we’re building the future we all aspire to – making net zero a reality. ROLE OVERVIEW The internship on the Mitsubishi Power Engineering Integration team allows a current student to gain valuable experience in the Power Industry. During their time with Mitsubishi, interns will perform an array of tasks that have direct impact on current internal and external projects we are executing. Mitsubishi will give the intern terrific experience in real world document management systems integration and control. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES • Assist Document Control Coordinators with day-to-day tasks.• Collaborate with engineering teams to support the development and deployment of new software tools for product configuration and requirements management.• Contribute to the development and refinement of project requirements by collaborating with stakeholders to ensure clarity, completeness, and feasibility.• Support Group Managers, Execution, and Applications Engineering with short- and long-term work assignments, ensuring timely and high-quality results.• Tasks may include schedule development, template creation, process improvement, database support, integration testing, and other assigned duties.• Gain a foundational understanding of power industry technology and product execution processes.• Perform other duties as required. OTHER DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES • Maintain a high-level understanding of core Mitsubishi Power products and technologies.• Exhibit analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve engineering challenges.• Work independently with minimal supervision once trained.• Participate actively in a collaborative environment focused on teamwork, quality, and innovation.• Communicate effectively with all levels of employees.• Adhere to all company policies, safety practices, and standard operating procedures.• Report unsafe activities to Management and/or Human Resources.• Protect confidential information and maintain the highest level of integrity.• Support company goals and contribute to a positive team spirit. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EDUCATION Education/Experience:• Active student pursuing a Bachelor’s degree (BS) in Engineering from a four-year accredited college or university. Language Skills:• Ability to read, analyze, and interpret business, professional, and technical materials.• Strong written and verbal communication skills, including report writing and presentations. Mathematical Skills:• Ability to perform basic mathematical operations and compute rates, ratios, and percentages.• Ability to interpret data and graphical information. Reasoning Ability:• Ability to solve practical problems and interpret a variety of instructions in written, oral, or diagram form. Computer Skills:• Moderate proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint).• Basic understanding of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) or Project Management tools such as Windchill, Codebeamer, Teamcenter, DevOps, Jira, or Jama is a plus. PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENT Regularly required to sit, talk, and hear; occasionally required to stand and walk.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY? • Excellent opportunity to gain experience in a leading global energy technology company• Exposure to real-world engineering and document management projects• Mentorship and learning from experienced professionals• Collaborative, inclusive work environment• Competitive internship compensation EEO STATEMENT Mitsubishi Power Americas, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer committed to workforce diversity.We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristic.
